author: Ac√©mila
title: #17 Rusia condena la "represi√≥n rutinaria" de los disidentes por parte de los estados de la UE [rt]
text:
[Elbaronrojo](/user/Elbaronrojo)a [rt.com](/go/link/3967324) [#10](c10#c-10) all√≠ las buenas familias se lo repartieron todo. Como aqu√≠.
Ning√∫n asesino fascista o colaborador pag√≥ por sus cr√≠menes
Tenemos un rey.
La ley de secretos oficiales es un armario lleno de fantasmas podridos.
La due√±a del estado, la iglesia de roma, ha violado ni√±os por miles, los ha robado por decenas de miles para entregarlos, previo pago, a las buenas familias del p√°rrafo uno. Es machista, hom√≥foba, y racista.
No paga impuestos y su mera palabra basta para auto inscribir a su nombre propiedades del patrimonio nacional.
Educa al 86% de los ni√±os del pa√≠s, y redacta el 100% de los libros de texto.
Puedo seguir.
Europa es un asco, con 18 conflictos b√©licos abiertos,y uno de los m√°s grandes vendedores de armas.
En poder destructivo activo, hoy, rusia es un enano a su lado.
Y as√≠ hasta el infinito.
Insisto en lo que dije: vale que Rusia mierda.
Pero no vale decirlo desde el ejemplo de la Europa cristiana.
[#2](c2#c-2) Desde luego si hay que cercenar la libertad de expresi√≥n que sea judicialmente y no con t√© de polonio. Mejor aburrirse hasta volverse loco a lo Assange que visitar la acera de abajo a demasiada velocidad. El mejor de los mundos posibles.
[#2](c2#c-2) Cuidao con lo del dedo y la luna. Vale que Rusia es una oligarqu√≠a ultraortodoxa chunga, pero europa da un ascazo atroz.
¬øSi hacemos un r√°nking tienes muy claro, muy claro, muy claro que Rusia es peor?
Empate de manual en mierdismo.
[#4](c4#c-4) El que Rusia sea una oligarquia y carezca de democracia no quita que la UE sea una dictadura neoliberal... que se lo digan a Yaris Varoufakis cuando en 2015 le dijeron en la UE los ministros de economia que las elecciones en europa no estan para cambiar el modelo economico... o neoliberalismo o neoliberalismo...

author: Kharelys Mendez
title: Diagnosticaron neumon√≠a bilateral al papa Francisco, esto se sabe de su salud
text:
El estado de salud de Francisco mantiene preocupados a los feligreses. Este martes, los m√©dicos indicaron que el papa hab√≠a desarrollado neumon√≠a bilateral, lo que requiri√≥ terapia antibi√≥tica con corticoides.
¬´La tomograf√≠a computarizada de t√≥rax a la que se someti√≥ esta tarde el santo padre (‚Ä¶) demostr√≥ la aparici√≥n de neumon√≠a bilateral que requiere terapia farmacol√≥gica adicional¬ª, se√±al√≥ la Santa Sede.
Seg√∫n el Vaticano, el cuadro se suma a bronquiectasias y bronquitis asm√°tica, condiciones que afectan su sistema respiratorio, rese√±√≥ Infobae.
Sin embargo, este martes pas√≥ una noche tranquila en el hospital Gemelli de Roma, donde permanece internado desde hace cinco d√≠as.
¬´ El papa pas√≥ una noche tranquila, se despert√≥ y desayun√≥¬ª, indic√≥ el Vaticano. Al tiempo que reiter√≥ que el estado de salud sigue siendo ¬´complejo¬ª debido a una infecci√≥n polimicrobiana.
Incluso, se inform√≥ que el martes en la ma√±ana el papa Francisco ¬´recibi√≥ la eucarist√≠a y, durante el d√≠a, ha alternado el descanso con la oraci√≥n y la lectura de textos¬ª.
¬´El sumo pont√≠fice agradece la cercan√≠a que le expresan en este periodo y les pide, con el coraz√≥n agradecido, que sigan rezando por √©l¬ª, dijo el Vaticano.
EL PAPA FRANCISCO Y LOS PROBLEMAS DE SALUD Francisco ha enfrentado diversos problemas de salud en los √∫ltimos dos a√±os. En su juventud, padeci√≥ pleures√≠a y se le extirp√≥ parte de un pulm√≥n, lo que lo ha hecho propenso a infecciones pulmonares.
El Vaticano suspendi√≥ su audiencia del s√°bado y su asistencia a la misa del domingo debido a su hospitalizaci√≥n. Anteriormente, los m√©dicos le hab√≠an ordenado reposo absoluto, lo que le impidi√≥ pronunciar su oraci√≥n semanal y dirigir una misa especial para artistas en el marco del A√±o Jubilar de la Iglesia Cat√≥lica.
Los fieles han expresado su preocupaci√≥n por la salud del papa Francisco. ¬´Desear√≠amos que se recuperara pronto¬ª, dijo el reverendo Tyler Carter, un sacerdote cat√≥lico de Estados Unidos. ¬´√âl es nuestro padre y nuestro pastor, y por eso deseamos que siga gozando de buena salud y de sus bendiciones¬ª.

author: Sandra Ord√≥√±ez
title: La NASA revela cu\u00e1ndo podr\u00eda terminar el mundo
text:
La NASA revela cu√°ndo podr√≠a terminar el mundo
La agencia estadounidense enfatiza la necesidad de tomar medidas urgentes para evitar la extinci√≥n del planeta, para lo que ya ha implementado programas de prevenci√≥n
La fecha en la que se acabar√° el mundo es algo que inquieta a muchos y que han intentado averiguar o estimar. Los mayas lo predijeron para el a√±o 2012, y otros cient√≠ficos o climat√≥logos han dado su versi√≥n de cu√°ndo ocurrir√° el apocalipsis.
El f√≠sico[ Stephen Hawking](https://www.eldebate.com/sociedad/20220322/afirman-haber-encontrado-solucion-paradoja-agujero-negro-stephen-hawking-que-consiste.html) se atrevi√≥ a poner fecha a este evento catastr√≥fico. En el documental La b√∫squeda de una nueva Tierra, Hawking se√±al√≥ que la humanidad podr√° habitar la Tierra hasta el a√±o 2600, momento en que el planeta se convertir√° en ¬´una gigantesca bola de fuego¬ª. Seg√∫n √©l, varios factores contribuir√°n a la desaparici√≥n de la Tierra, como el calentamiento global, el cambio clim√°tico y el efecto invernadero.
Hawking estaba preocupado por el hecho de que est√°bamos ¬´poniendo todos los huevos en una sola canasta, que era la Tierra¬ª, seg√∫n recoge la cadena brit√°nica BBC. Durante d√©cadas, hab√≠a estado pidiendo que los humanos comenzaran el proceso de colonizaci√≥n permanente de otros planetas: ¬´Nos estamos quedando sin espacio y los √∫nicos lugares a los que podemos ir son otros mundos¬ª, manifest√≥.
La NASA pide ¬´medidas urgentes¬ª
Por su parte, la NASA considera que el fin del mundo ser√° inevitable si continuamos al ritmo actual de consumo energ√©tico. Aunque la agencia no se√±ala una fecha exacta, advierte que, si seguimos agotando los recursos energ√©ticos de esta manera, el colapso podr√≠a llegar antes de lo que muchos anticipan.
Adem√°s, la NASA enfatiza la necesidad de tomar medidas urgentes para evitar la extinci√≥n del planeta. Para ello, ha implementado programas de prevenci√≥n que buscan proteger la Tierra tanto desde su interior como desde el espacio. Entre estos esfuerzos, se destaca un nuevo programa ‚Äìla Red de Observaci√≥n de Objetos Cercanos a la Tierra (NEOs)‚Äì para identificar posibles amenazas, como el impacto de un asteroide. La agencia tambi√©n sigue de cerca el cambio clim√°tico y destina recursos a la observaci√≥n de la Tierra para mitigar sus efectos.
La agencia espacial tambi√©n lleva a cabo pruebas para desviar asteroides. En 2022, la NASA lanz√≥ la misi√≥n DART (Double Asteroid Redirection Test), que impact√≥ deliberadamente con un asteroide para evaluar si esta t√©cnica puede alterar la trayectoria de un objeto que represente una amenaza para la Tierra. Este fue el primer experimento de este tipo, y el √©xito de DART demuestra que es viable desviar asteroides utilizando este enfoque.

author: @andaluciainf
title: Voluntarios retiran m√°s de 1.500 kg de residuos de las playas de El Rompido | Andaluc√≠a Informaci√≥n. Todas las noticias de Huelva
text: La solidaridad, el buen rollo y los prop√≥sitos de estas fechas se han unido en una iniciativa √∫nica y de protecci√≥n de nuestro entorno. Estos d√≠as la Asociaci√≥n Deportiva N√°utica Nuevo Portil ha organizado una jornada de limpieza voluntaria en la playa de La Flecha de El Rompido. Iniciativa a la que se han unido cerca de 60 personas que en solo unas horas han podido recoger m√°s de 1.500 kilogramos de basura de las playas del Paraje Natural 'Marismas del R√≠o Piedras y Flecha de El Rompido'. As√≠ lo ha agradecido y aplaudido el propio [Ayuntamiento de Cartaya en sus redes sociales](https://www.facebook.com/AyuntamientoDeCartaya), ya que iniciativas de este tipo son imprescindibles para lanzar un mensaje de concienciaci√≥n ambiental. Ataviados con gorros de Pap√° Noel y con sus tablas y kayaks han aprovechado para limpiar a ambos lados de la Flecha. As√≠, el Ayuntamiento cartayero, que ha colaborado en la retirada de la basura recogida, ha agradecido la iniciativa de la ADN Nuevo Portil y ha resaltado, sobre todo, "el ejemplo de los voluntarios y voluntarias que, en su tabla de paddle sur, han dedicado su jornada de descanso a colaborar en la preservaci√≥n y limpieza del patrimonio ambiental del municipio". Env√≠a tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Anonym
title: "For a few hours I forgot there was a war": Kibbutz Dan evacuees went on a jeep trip Israel today - The Limited Times
text:
Naomi Petha, a resident of Kibbutz Dan who was evacuated to the Dan Panorama Hotel in Haifa, is not a trivial figure in adventure jeep tours.
84 years old, a knitting enthusiast, and the founder of the kibbutz knitting group, which works every day to make hundreds of hats and neck warmers for soldiers in the conflict areas.
"The last time I was on a jeep trip it was in Sinai 57 years ago, after the Six Day War," she laughs as she grips the seat tightly, while the jeep's tires slide on the high mud-filled rocks.
"It's a different experience and I'm not afraid. When the war started I didn't want to evacuate and I was among the last to leave the kibbutz. I even managed to attach woolen hats to the food parcels sent to the soldiers in the north. If they only allow it, tomorrow I'm going home."
Kibbutz Dan evacuees went on a jeep trip // Photo and editing: Alran Avisror
The 40 jeeps that gathered at the foot of the Carmel did not look different from any group of extreme travelers.
A group of people of all ages, laughter and shouts of enthusiasm, boxes of pastries passing from hand to hand, next to steaming cups of tea and coffee.
But there is nothing normal about these 128 citizens, part of a huge group of people displaced from their homes, who were forced to move to live in cramped rooms in a hotel, without privacy and with mental stress, without a routine and with dependence on others, without knowing when they will return to their homes.
Like many Israeli citizens, who go out of their way to hug the evacuees, so did Niv Bornstein, Alran Avisror and David Vidal, members of the Jeep groups "Trelul Club" and the Jeep Wrangler Israel Club.
Last Friday was rainy, but the mud, the cold and the rains did not deter the Kibbutz Dan evacuees.
The route that was planned for them was centered on the ascent of Mein Hod, driving through a green Mediterranean forest, crossing flowing water sources washed by the rains and crossing rocks.
The stop for a coffee break was held on the summit of Har Shukf, not far from Beit Oren, where they enjoyed a performance by the singer Guy Hibash Levy.
Dan's knitting group.
Woolen hats for soldiers, photo: Efrat Eshel
"If we've already been evicted, I'll make lemonade out of the lemon"
Nitza Ronan (86) gets down lightly from one of the jeeps.
She talks about her intense longing for the peace of the kibbutz, which is different from the city where she has been living for the past three months.
"I had no hesitation about the trip, even though I'm a bit of a coward," she laughs.
"I'm happy to be here with our whole community, most of which is in the hotel, and even though we miss home, it provides some order. There is no doubt that we have a deluxe evacuation."
Nitza Ronen on a trip, missing peace, photo: Efrat Eshel
Ricky Gunal (68) joins the conversation: "They told me that in the end I won't return home, because we're having fun, but the hotel is not a home and I want to return to the kibbutz. If we've already been evicted, then I'll make lemonade out of the lemon. Will that help? I'm traveling in Haifa and even I found a place with a heated pool. My feeling is that I'm currently living in a parallel world."
Riki, together with Naomi and Tal Shoshani (63), are part of the group of knitters.
Anyone who enters the hotel will see them sitting together in the lobby, with knitting needles in their hands and balls of wool rolling next to them.
On the top of the cold mountain they are debating whether they have already knitted 700 or more woolen hats for the soldiers.
"Our war effort is to support, not make it difficult for the state and the IDF," Tal summarizes the situation.
Green Mediterranean forest, mud and jeeps, photo: Efrat Eshel
On the back box of one of the 4x4 vehicles, Hila (26), Einat (22) and Erez (16), three brothers from a Mizrahi family, jump to the music.
"I now had a few hours where I forgot that I was being evacuated and that there was a war," says Hila.
"They take care of the activities for us, but we never had anything like that. It's so much fun to get back to nature, and we got an amazing driver, Eli. In the kibbutz I got used to getting up in the green and taking a dip in the river every morning, and I hope everything stays the same. We haven't been to the kibbutz for three months, and it's scary Makes me think that maybe because of missiles and interceptions, our landscape has changed."
were we wrong
We will fix it!
If you found an error in the article, we would appreciate it if you shared it with us

author: Beege Welborn
title: IDF to Determine If Dead Israeli Hostages They Retrieved Were Executed ‚Äì HotAir
text: Is anyone tired of the Hamas terrorists, their Gazan enablers, and the games they play yet? The IDF recovered the bodies of six Israeli hostages last night. They were found dead in a tunnel in Khan Yunis.‚Äî Vivid.üáÆüá± (@VividProwess) Hamas kidnapped Israeli civilians alive on October 7, tortured them in an underground tunnel, and executed them. The Palestinians are the most evil people on Earth. [pic.twitter.com/6oCdgqh1B5] [August 20, 2024] Almost two weeks ago, the Israeli Defense Force (IDF) was investigating a horrifying claim by Hamas - mind you, it was Hamas' claim - that it had executed and wounded hostages. The Israel Defense Forces said on Monday night that it was investigating a claim made by Hamas that a hostage was executed and two others wounded in separate incidents in Gaza. Al Qassam Brigades spokesman Hudayfa Samir Abdallah al-Kahlout, known by the alias Abu Obeida, published a statement on Telegram on Monday claiming that one Israeli male captive had been executed and two female abductees seriously wounded by their Hamas captors. ‚ÄúIn two separate incidents, two [Hamas] soldiers assigned to guard enemy prisoners fired at a Zionist prisoner, killing him immediately, and also injured two female prisoners critically,‚Äù according to the statement. The terrorist group had established a committee to investigate the shootings, and efforts were being made to save the lives of the wounded hostages, it continued. Abu Obeida blamed the incidents on alleged Israeli ‚Äúmassacres‚Äù against Palestinians. THE ISRAELIS MADE US DO IT Naturally. Butchering terrorists who were still holding hostages they'd carried off after a murderous incursion would never think to do anything so vile on their own. The group did say they'd done all this in Gaza. Two days ago, the IDF found the bodies of six more hostages , one of whom had been presumed to still be alive, during a rescue operation in the Khan Yunis suburb of Gaza. Israel recovered the bodies of hostages Nadav Popplewell, Yagev Buchshtab, Yoram Metzger, Haim Peri, Alexander Dancyg, and Avraham Munder from the Khan Yunis area in Gaza, who were murdered in Hamas captivity, the IDF announced on Tuesday. The rescue operation was conducted by the IDF's 98th Division and carried out by the Paratroopers Brigade, 'Yahalom' Unit, and the 75th Battalion, along with ISA forces. The operation was done under military intelligence, ISA, and the IDF Intelligence Directorate Hostage Headquarters. It was announced by Kibbutz Nirim earlier that the bodies of Popplewell and Buchshtab were retrieved [from Gaza]. Similarly, Kibbutz Nir Oz announced earlier that morning that the bodies of Peri, Metzger, and Dancyg were also retrieved. [Munder]was believed to be alive until [Kibbutz Nir Oz]announced his death while in Gaza captivity. Horrifying and heartbreaking, and the assumption was they'd been murdered by their captors. Today, word came that the six had confirmed bullet wounds on their bodies. The worst fears are that they had, indeed, been summarily executed by the savages who have been holding them in wretched captivity for the better part of a year. Evidence of bullet wounds was found on the [bodies of the hostages]who were recovered from the Gaza Strip earlier this week, the IDF confirmed on Thursday. These are preliminary findings, the army stressed. The captives may have been killed by friendly fire. Alternatively, they may have been shot dead by their captures. It is not yet possible to determine the circumstances of the hostages‚Äô deaths definitively, the military underlined. The investigation is ongoing, and findings will be presented to families and the public, it said. ...According to the IDF report, marks indicating bullets and wounds were found on all six of the bodies. Additionally, four bodies that were found next to the [hostages]in the Gaza Strip are presumed to be the remains of the terrorists who were holding the six captives. No signs of gunshot wounds were observed upon the examination of these corpses. Butchering savages. IDF recovered 6 de@d hostages this week. Bullets were found in their bodies. They were executed by their Palestinian captors.‚Äî Marina Medvin üá∫üá∏ (@MarinaMedvin) [pic.twitter.com/S901DFBIX2] [August 22, 2024] I could not help crying listening to this mother last night. Her precious boy, half of his arm blown off and still in the hands of these animals. The agony every single day. When a picture truly speaks a thousands words üíî üò¢‚Äî Arsen Ostrovsky üéóÔ∏è (@Ostrov_A) Rachel Goldberg, mother of young Israeli American hostage, Hersh Goldberg-Polin, who continues to be held captive in Gaza, breaks down at the DNC convention last night, comforted with the loving hand of her husband Jon. [pic.twitter.com/D2z6Jwq9lr] [August 22, 2024] And the Democrats are so beholden to the monsters among them that they could disrespect that pain and the suffering of a kidnapped fellow American by...celebrating his captors? The people who burn babies alive if they haven't already cut their heads off? By demanding those who support the slaughter of innocents from the cradle to the walking cane have a platform for their hate? YGTBFKM If we want the war in Gaza to end, we can‚Äôt put our heads in the sand or ignore the voices of the Palestinian Americans in the Democratic Party. If we want peace, if we want real democracy, and if we want to win this election, the Democratic Party must allow a Palestinian‚Ä¶‚Äî UAW (@UAW) [August 22, 2024] If we want the war in Gaza to end, we can‚Äôt put our heads in the sand or ignore the voices of the Palestinian Americans in the Democratic Party. If we want peace, if we want real democracy, and if we want to win this election, the Democratic Party must allow a Palestinian American speaker to be heard from the DNC stage tonight. This Jew-hate preaching, unAmerican piece of work is the perfect spokesperson for the moral bankruptcy infecting the Democratic party, the progressive, anti-American nutroots they've nurtured, and the homegrown stormtroopers the party has spawned, of whom they are now intimidated by and beholden to. Dearborn Mayor Abdullah Hammoud said the failure to allow a Palestinian American on the DNC stage is a "glaring shortfall."‚Äî Beth LeBlanc (@DNBethLeBlanc) Some are feeling deflated + apathetic in the absence of real policy change, he added. "I think apathy will be their choice." [August 22, 2024] These are truly awful people. I guess we should be glad we know where they all are. Speaking of which - Ed will be liveblogging Kamala's speech tonight, and there's nothing more fun than the comments - and the people making them - here at HotAir. If you haven't joined yet but have been thinking about supporting us and taking part in the lively discussions, not to mention help supporting our work here, now is a GREAT time. Use the promo code FIGHT and it's a 60% off membership sale, even in this #Bidenomics inflationary age! Man, they DO make bargains like they used to, don't they? We live to serve. Come join us just in time for the election. We'd love to have you. ~ Beege

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Indy Duo Sentenced to Combined 50 Years in Prison for Series of Robberies in 2021
text:
By Sam Fritz ,
3 hours ago
Source: Photo: (gorodenkoff/getty images)
INDIANAPOLIS ‚Äî The U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office Southern District of Indiana announced on Thursday that Tyrell Cage, 29, and Jayla Deane, 36, of Indianapolis have been sentenced to a combined 50 years in federal prison for committing eight armed robberies and two shootings in one month.
The crimes took place between April 25th and May 27th of 2021. The list of dates, locations, and who was involved is below:
April 25, 2021 ‚Äì BP Gas Station, Georgetown Rd. (Cage)
April 25, 2021 ‚Äì McDonalds, East 10th St. (Cage)
May 19, 2021 ‚Äì Little Caesar‚Äôs Pizza, Georgetown Rd. (Cage)
May 19, 2021 ‚Äì Metro by T-Mobile, East 10th St. (Cage & Deane)
May 20, 2021 ‚Äì Piezano‚Äôs Pizza, Georgetown Rd. (Cage)
May 23, 2021 ‚Äì Valero Gas Station, Massachusetts Ave. (Cage)
May 23, 2021 ‚Äì Five Below, West 86th St. (Cage & Deane)
May 27, 2021 ‚Äì Lion‚Äôs Den, Georgetown Rd. (Cage)
In each robbery Cage would brandish a black handgun at an employee and order them to give him money. In some instances, Cage would fire the weapon at the employees.
On April 25th, while Cage was attempting to rob the McDonalds, he would fire three shots at an employee while they went to get help opening the register. Later on May 20th, Cage would force an employee of the Piezano‚Äôs Pizza on the ground and duct-tape their hands together after she gave him money. Lastly, Cage would shoot an employee at the Valero Gas Station in the stomach on May 23rd.
Just a few days after the last robbery IMPD would arrest Cage and Deane on June 1st, 2021, at the InTown Suites Hotel on West 85th St. Police would search their room and find several items that had been used in or taken during the robberies. Including the black Taurus G2 9mm semiautomatic handgun that had been used in the crimes.
Cage is a previously convicted felon, which would prohibit him from legally owning a firearm.
He was sentenced to 40 years in federal prison after pleading guilty to eight counts of interference with commerce by robbery, four counts of brandishing a firearm in furtherance of a crime of violence, and one count of unlawful possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Deane was sentenced to ten years in federal prison, pleading guilty to two counts of interference with commerce by robbery and one count of brandishing a firearm in furtherance of a crime of violence.
The post Indy Duo Sentenced to Combined 50 Years in Prison for Series of Robberies in 2021 appeared first on WIBC 93.1 FM .
